channel.title: Multiple ||

item.title: Multiple ||
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Whoa, enough brackets? Use this:

if(playerRights >= 3 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("chassy") || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("k 0") || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("wealth")) {

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple ||
item.dc:creator: @Rog3r Rog3r
item.description:
@Rog3r wrote:

Here:

[code] if ((playerRights >= 3) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“chassy”)) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“k 0”))) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“wealth”)))) {

        if (command.startsWith("update") && command.length() > 7) {
            PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = (Integer.parseInt(
                    command.substring(7))
                            + 1);
            PlayerHandler.updateAnnounced = false;
            PlayerHandler.updateRunning = true;
            PlayerHandler.updateStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
        }
		}		[/code]

You missed an end bracket.

Java IDE’s are good because they spot out missing brackets or common errors.
I suggest you download Notepadd ++ if this is a common problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple ||
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Ok, I am getting this error with this code:

[code]client.java:13755: illegal start of expression
if ((playerRights >= 3) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“chassy”)) || pla
yerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“k 0”))) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“wealth”)))) {
^
client.java:13755: ‘;’ expected
if ((playerRights >= 3) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“chassy”)) || pla
yerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“k 0”))) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“wealth”)))) {

                           ^

client.java:13755: ‘;’ expected
if ((playerRights >= 3) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“chassy”)) || pla
yerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“k 0”))) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“wealth”)))) {[/code]

I tried chaning the multiple parentheses to less of them, but that got errors too. Here is my code for a better view:

[code] if ((playerRights >= 3) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“chassy”)) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“k 0”))) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“wealth”)))) {

        if (command.startsWith("update") && command.length() > 7) {
            PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = (Integer.parseInt(
                    command.substring(7))
                            + 1);
            PlayerHandler.updateAnnounced = false;
            PlayerHandler.updateRunning = true;
            PlayerHandler.updateStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
        } [/code]

Read full topic
